result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jayden Duane Beamon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jayden Duane Beamon appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Jayden Duane Beamon.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Status conference held.  Atty.  requests a final pretrial and trial date.  Court orders any pretrial documents be filed no later than 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case is adjourned to Br. 1.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jayden Duane Beamon in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim wittness coordinator and victim present. Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Plaisted has received discovery, still needs an offer and would like a status date.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.   This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties. Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Patricia B B DOB 05/01/1973
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.   No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Jayden Duane Beamon in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Jayden Duane Beamon in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jayden Duane Beamon appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
